wiki.summary: “Mother“ is a song by American singer Meghan Trainor. It was released on March 10, 2023 as the third official single from Trainor's fifth studio album, Takin' It Back, and the first single from its deluxe edition. The track was written by Trainor along with with Sean Douglas, Gian Stone and Justin Trainor. The track is a doo-wop track with electro-pop influences. The chorus of the track features a sample from the 1954 song "Mr. Sandman" by the Chordettes. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Mother“ is a song by American singer Meghan Trainor. It was released on March 10, 2023 as the third official single from Trainor's fifth studio album, Takin' It Back, and the first single from its deluxe edition. The track was written by Trainor along with with Sean Douglas, Gian Stone and Justin Trainor. The track is a doo-wop track with electro-pop influences. The chorus of the track features a sample from the 1954 song "Mr. Sandman" by the Chordettes. Lyrically, it describes negative experiences with men mansplaining with the main message being to listen to your mother. Meghan Trainor first announced the song on YouTube shorts a few days after the announcement of her first book themed around motherhood. She then teased the song across Tik Tok in dancing videos with TikTok influencer, Chris Olsen, and her husband, Daryl Sabara. The snippet of the track garnered much attention across the internet, gaining over 50 million views on Twitter. A music video for the track was released the same day as the deluxe album release. This music video stars Kris Jenner and features colorful backgrounds and dancing. "Mother" was sent to Hot AC Radio in the US on March 27, 2023 and later sent to Italian radio on April 7, 2023. It reached the top 40 in numerous countries across the world, reaching #1 on the Sweden Heatseeker chart. In the US, the song peaked at #19 on Billboard Bubbling Under as well as #22 on the Adult Top 40 chart. Read more on Last.fm.
